guild.description:
This guild is about News far and wide!

Sister guild: +Commentary

#1. Things that are posted to News should be stated like a fact in the Headline.

In the sense, Headline: X happened or X said this. Not Personal opinions. 

They should be reporting.

#2. Personal slant or commentary should go in the comments, not the Headline. Commentary content (like discussion commentator shows) are not News. Commentary content will be redirected to +Commentary which is for that purpose. 

If it's News but is more an opinion piece please add [Opinion] in the title, or post in a topic specific guild. 

#3. No screenshots; provide a link, provide a source.

See Posting Etiquette pin for further explanation.
guild.description_html:
This guild is about News far and wide!

They should be reporting.

#2. Personal slant or commentary should go in the comments, not the Headline. Commentary content (like discussion commentator shows) are not News. Commentary content will be redirected to +Commentary which is for that purpose.

If it's News but is more an opinion piece please add [Opinion] in the title, or post in a topic specific guild.

#3. No screenshots; provide a link, provide a source.

See Posting Etiquette pin for further explanation.

post.title: US govt to issue wallet-sized COVID-19 proof of vaccination cards

body: TIL keeping a physical record of the date of administration, batch number, and date of manufacture of the vaccine you've received isn't prudent record keeping - it's ackshually the New World Order taking over.
body_html: TIL keeping a physical record of the date of administration, batch number, and date of manufacture of the vaccine you've received isn't prudent record keeping - it's ackshually the New World Order taking over.

post.title: US govt to issue wallet-sized COVID-19 proof of vaccination cards

body:
If you're getting one through your primary care physician they'll probably just log it in whatever standard way they log vaccinations there.  If you're in a job that requires you to show evidence - like a healthcare worker, etc - you would probably want a separate card so you are minimizing the revelation of your health info.  

This vaccination is likely to be rolled out on an industrial scale, so you probably aren't going to your PCP to get vaccinated.  You'll probably get vaccinated under a pop-up tent in an elementary school parking lot by a retired nurse named Gloria.  She lives two counties over.
body_html:
If you're getting one through your primary care physician they'll probably just log it in whatever standard way they log vaccinations there. If you're in a job that requires you to show evidence - like a healthcare worker, etc - you would probably want a separate card so you are minimizing the revelation of your health info.

This vaccination is likely to be rolled out on an industrial scale, so you probably aren't going to your PCP to get vaccinated. You'll probably get vaccinated under a pop-up tent in an elementary school parking lot by a retired nurse named Gloria. She lives two counties over.

post.title: US govt to issue wallet-sized COVID-19 proof of vaccination cards

body:
Why should anyone have to show proof of vaccination for this virus vs. really nasty ones like polio, for which I already have a record, and for which, no one asks me. 

You seem to be assuming a lot of underlying premises to explain why a government issued Covid 19 vaccination proof card is valid thing on which to direct resources.
body_html:
Why should anyone have to show proof of vaccination for this virus vs. really nasty ones like polio, for which I already have a record, and for which, no one asks me.

You seem to be assuming a lot of underlying premises to explain why a government issued Covid 19 vaccination proof card is valid thing on which to direct resources.

post.title: US govt to issue wallet-sized COVID-19 proof of vaccination cards

body:
Nurses have to show proof that they're vaccinated.  So do teachers.  A lot of public-facing jobs that tend to be at friction points for disease are required to show proof that they've been vaccinated.

My own mother has to be vaccinated for the flu every year as a condition of her employment.
body_html:
Nurses have to show proof that they're vaccinated. So do teachers. A lot of public-facing jobs that tend to be at friction points for disease are required to show proof that they've been vaccinated.

My own mother has to be vaccinated for the flu every year as a condition of her employment.

So no one needs a separate card then. 

And very few people should have to show proof of vaccination for this virus, right?

post.title: US govt to issue wallet-sized COVID-19 proof of vaccination cards

body:
Some might.  Some might just need a card to keep track of doses, batches, and dates.

If you want to be retarded and think that keeping track of a vaccine after an epidemic is Bill Gates rummaging around in your underpants, that's on you.
body_html:
Some might. Some might just need a card to keep track of doses, batches, and dates.

If you want to be retarded and think that keeping track of a vaccine after an epidemic is Bill Gates rummaging around in your underpants, that's on you.

body:

Fucking piece of shit statist.
